VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted three acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
CAP for SIR 2024C0000834SI is not due to be completed until 6/15/24. Currenlty
they have completed their review of DCWL rules, signed acknowledegement forms,
changed annual training dates, received approval on new policies from myself, and
provided couseling to the staff involved in the incident. This has all been verified.
CAP for SIR 2023C0000739SI regarding a violation for staff using profanity directed
at a youth consists of having staff complete CPI refresher trainings as well as
verbal intervention trainings. This CAP is still being monitored.
CAP for SIR 20240000834SI regarding violations of physical punishment,
inappropriate and unwarranted restraints, seclusions, restraint notifications and
incident report documentations consists of coaching/counseling involved staff, CPI
refreshers, DCWL rule trainings, seclusion variance reviews, administrative review
of MISACWIS incident reports and staff training on MISACWIS incident report
requirements. This CAP is still being monitored.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit in 2024.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Agency is in compliance of PREA determined by Prea audit.

Chief Administrator Assessment
I reviewed the Chief Administrator Assessment. There are no issues noted. The
agency was in compliance with last year’s audit and has maintained that standard
throughout the year.
The Chief Administrator reports staff are receiving their annual trainings and
administration is providing reviews of all instances of physical management that
includes the review of camera footage when available. The report states
investigations are reviewed by administration and policies and procedures are
modified if needed.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff and youth were interviewed and there were no concerns noted. Youth were
able to verbalize activities being completed and needs provided. Staff vocalized
smaller numbers of youth in the program and “raise the age” issues. With smaller
numbers, the agency is able to maintain program better. The agency separates
youth, by placing them in different pods for “raise the age” issue.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Agency is well maintained. All areas were clean and art projects were seen on
walls. A sensory room was started this year and appears to be helping some youth.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
